nub.timing

Class TimingHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • nub.timing.TimingHandler

  • public class TimingHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    A timing handler holds a taskPool() with all the tasks scheduled to be performed in the future (one single time or periodically).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static long frameCount 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      TimingHandler()
      Main constructor.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      long frameCount()
      Returns the number of frames displayed since this timing handler was instantiated.

      Returns the approximate frame rate of the software as it executes.

      Handler's main method.

      Returns true if the task is registered and false otherwise.

    • Field Detail

      • frameCount

        public static long frameCount

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimingHandler

        public TimingHandler()
        Main constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle()
        Handler's main method. It should be called from within your main event loop. It recomputes the frame rate, and executes all non-concurrent tasks found in the taskPool().

      • taskPool

        public java.util.ArrayList<Task> taskPool()
        Returns the task pool.

      • registerTask

        public void registerTask(Task task)
        Register a task in the pool.

      • unregisterTask

        public void unregisterTask(Task task)
        Unregisters the task.

      • isTaskRegistered

        public boolean isTaskRegistered(Task task)
        Returns true if the task is registered and false otherwise.

      • frameRate

        public float frameRate()
        Returns the approximate frame rate of the software as it executes. The initial value is 10 fps and is updated with each frame. The value is averaged (integrated) over several frames. As such, this value won't be valid until after 5-10 frames.

      • frameCount

        public long frameCount()
        Returns the number of frames displayed since this timing handler was instantiated.
